page.title: 06Changing Times
page.content: We went to see Mrs. Hollingsworth who has lived in Eltham since 1910. She can remember Eltham as a village and going on the trams from Eltham to the Blackwall Tunnel.Her father worked on a horse bus and she got free rides. In her childhood large families might not have any socks or shoes and many had clothes passed down from others. The school leaving age was 14 and when you left school you were picked out to do jobs.Sometimes a nurse would come round to see if you were clean enough. In the early days of television only a few families had them so they went round to their friends to watch the Queen's coronation.In Eltham there were many street parties on coronation day. (1953) Pupils-St Thomas More School.
